column4: hello, I'v got question, when I will delete etc/fstab, after restart, will ubuntu recovery and mount my partitions ?
no
so what I can do to mount my partitions? because I edited my fstab file by nano and something was broken, and after restrt I have not any partitions ntfs
post the contents of /etc/fstab on paste.ubuntu-nl.org , along with the output of sudo fdisk -l
I'll help you get that back
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/22999/
and you have *no* /etc/fstab at all?
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/23000/   there is my fstab file, but in /media there is only empty folders
you do have ntfs-3g installed?
yep
dpkg -l ntfs-3g to double check: if the first two characters are ii, it's installed
yes it's installed
ok, I'm interested in a couple of error messages: type sudo umount /media/sda2 ; if it says it's not mounted, then type sudo mount /media/sda2
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/23001/
I'd do what it says :)
if you don't want to boot windows, I'd do option 2
so use force ?
I'm real protective of my ntfs partition in linux. I don't use ntfs-3g yet, it's not ready for my prime time. I'd do the double boot because I'm very conservative
and then go browse the net, trying to figure out why ntfs-3g needs a hack like that
okey. so you think that after boot windows and back to ubuntu, I'll can mount partitions ?
like it says, boot twice.
cheers, bye :)
